results.title: The Turn of the screw
results.creator_credit: Dan Curtis Productions and Dan Curtis
results.brief_description: Based on Henry James’ novel “The Turn of the screw,” this made for television adaptation stars Lynn Redgrave as Miss Jane Cubberly, a young English governess who is hired to take care of two orphaned children, Miles (Jasper Jacob) and Flora (Eva Griffith), who live in an old country mansion. However, it is not long before Miss Cubberly soon discovers that things are not quite as they seem. The children’s behaviour is most disturbing and at times bordering on evil, whilst the house itself appears to possess an unnatural “presence.” This gothic horror has been adapted into many film versions, most notably “The Innocents” in 1961 starring Deborah Kerr and directed by Jack Clayton. Cast also includes: Megs Jenkins, John Baron, Anthony Lagdon, Kathryn Scott, James Laurenson, Benedict Taylor.

results.title: The Turn of the screw
results.creator_credit: Martin Pope, Meridian Broadcasting and Ben Bolt
results.brief_description: This moody, atmospheric rendition of the Henry James novel stars Jodhi May as the governess entrusted with the care of two seemingly adorable children whom she suspects may be under the influence of supernatural powers. Rumours abound regarding the previous governess - Miss Jessel, who killed herself when she became pregnant to her master’s valet, Peter Quint, also now dead. Both Jessel and Quint begin appearing to the governess, who learns the children can see them too, particularly the boy. Unable to contact the orphaned children’s guardian (Colin Firth) due to a clause in her contract which prohibits any contact, the young governess must face the unknown alone if she is to save the soul of the children. Cast also includes Pam Ferris, Joe Sowerbutts and Grace Robinson.

results.title: The Turn of the screw
results.creator_credit: Unitel, Fernseh produktiongesellschaft, Zdenek Oves, Hans-Gunther Herbetz and Petr Weigl
results.brief_description: This is an opera based on the Henry James story “Turn of the screw” written by Benjamin Britten. Performed by the Royal Opera at Covent Garden, it features Magdalena Vasaryova, Juraj Kukura and Dana Medricka. The story revolves around a governess who looks after two orphaned children in the country on the proviso that she would never write to their young guardian, their uncle.

results.title: The Turkish question
results.creator_credit: National Educational Television and Joseph Krumgold
results.brief_description: A survey of the social and economic conditions in Turkey, where the traditions and history of the people make it difficult for them to adjust to a modern way of life.
results.description: A survey of the social and economic conditions in Turkey, where the traditions and history of the people make it difficult for them to adjust to a modern way of life.

results.title: The Turbulent ocean
results.creator_credit: MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology) and Bert Shapiro
results.brief_description: A documentary film about oceanography - trying to determine theoretical eddies, to predict turbulence and ocean storms. Also an ocean-going research study to find a mode-eddy - which they did.

results.title: The Tuna coast
results.creator_credit: Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production and Fred Clarke
results.brief_description: Filmed against the splendour of the rugged south-east coast of Tasmania, the deep-sea fishing enthusiast meets his match hunting the mighty tuna. Examines the well-established sport of deep-sea fishing showing two anglers on the hunt for tuna and other big game fish.

results.title: The Truth about cats and dogs
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Noon Attack, Cari-Esta Albert, Richard Hashimoto and Michael Lehmann
results.brief_description: When panicked photographer Brian has trouble with a disagreeable Great Dane, he calls Dr Abby Barnes (Janeane Garofalo) a radio veterinarian whose daily program helps people with their problem pets. The pair develop an instant connection over the telephone and the eager Brian invites Abby out, asking for a description of herself so he can find her in a crowd. Lacking in self-confidence, Abby describes her neigbour, best friend and model, Noelle (Uma Thurman). When Abby stands him up, Ben comes to the studio looking for answers, and happens to see Noelle. Abby explains the situation to Noelle, who agrees to take her place, while Abby assumes the character of Donna. While Abby develops a relationship with Brian over the telephone and the radio, Noelle is the woman he believes he is talking to. Things become more complicated when Noelle falls for Brian, and Brian starts to wonder why his new girlfriend seems to have two different personalities.

results.title: The Trusteeship Council and system
results.creator_credit: J.C. Sheers and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United Nations: its charter and organization”
Demonstrates the aims, structure and mechanics of the Trusteeship Council by showing the improved standard of living and eventual independence of Somaliland under the administration of Italy.

results.title: The Trumpet of the swan
results.creator_credit: Lin Oliver, Tiny Tot Productions, Richard Rich and Terry L Noss
results.brief_description: Louie, a Trumpeter swan born without a voice, falls in love but has no way of communicating his emotions. Feeling despondent and at odds with his siblings with wonderful calls, he leaves home on a journey where he meets a young boy called Sam and his teacher, Mrs Hammerbotham, who teaches Louie how to speak. Learning English is not the solution to Louie’s problem however as none of the other swans can understand him. A solution is reached when Louie’s father gives his son a trumpet which he begins to play proficiently. Unbeknownst to Louie though, his father has stolen the trumpet in a moment of desperation to help his son. A stint in a jazz band and a race to reclaim his now engaged childhood love, Serena, ensues in this animated adaption of E.B. White’s classic children’s tale. Features the voices of Dee Baker, Jason Alexander, Reese Witherspoon, Seth Green, Carol Burnett, Mary Steenburgen and Joe Mantegna.

results.title: The Trumpet
results.creator_credit: National Committee for Audio-Visual Aids in Education and Anvil Films and Record Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Philip Jones talks of the history of the trumpet and examines its development. Comparisons are made with the cornet and the bugle, and we see such early instruments as the slide trumpet and the trumpet with crooks. Several famous works for the trumpet are played.
